unnormalised: **Injury Updates: Key Players Sidelined Ahead of Crucial Fixtures**
normalised: **Injury Updates: Key Players Sidelined Ahead of Crucial Fixtures**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Several key players across various sports are facing injury setbacks, impacting their participation in upcoming crucial matches. The situation is particularly concerning for the Indian cricket team preparing for the Asia Cup finals, and domestic football leagues are also feeling the strain.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Several key players across various sports are facing injury setbacks, impacting their participation in upcoming crucial matches. The situation is particularly concerning for the Indian cricket team preparing for the Asia Cup finals, and domestic football leagues are also feeling the strain.

unnormalised: In cricket, star batsman Rohit Sharma is currently undergoing physiotherapy for a minor hamstring strain sustained during the recent match against Pakistan. While initial reports suggest the injury isn't severe, his availability for the final is still uncertain. A decision will be made after further assessment by the BCCI medical team at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. “We are monitoring Rohit’s progress closely. We are hopeful he'll recover in time, but we won’t risk him if he’s not 100% fit,” stated a team spokesperson.
normalised: In cricket, star batsman Rohit Sharma is currently undergoing physiotherapy for a minor hamstring strain sustained during the recent match against Pakistan. While initial reports suggest the injury isn't severe, his availability for the final is still uncertain. A decision will be made after further assessment by the B C C I medical team at the National Cricket Academy (N C A) in Bengaluru. “We are monitoring Rohit’s progress closely. We are hopeful he'll recover in time, but we won’t risk him if he’s not one hundred percent fit,” stated a team spokesperson.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, in football, East Bengal’s key midfielder, Anirudh Thapa, suffered an ankle injury during training. Reports indicate a possible ligament tear, potentially sidelining him for 4-6 weeks. This is a major blow for East Bengal, who are aiming for a strong showing in the upcoming Durand Cup. Coach Carles Cuadrat expressed his disappointment, stating, “Anirudh is a vital player for us. His absence will be felt.”
normalised: Meanwhile, in football, East Bengal’s key midfielder, Anirudh Thapa, suffered an ankle injury during training. Reports indicate a possible ligament tear, potentially sidelining him for four to six weeks. This is a major blow for East Bengal, who are aiming for a strong showing in the upcoming Durand Cup. Coach Carles Cuadrat expressed his disappointment, stating, “Anirudh is a vital player for us. His absence will be felt.”

unnormalised: Kabaddi player, Pardeep Narwal, known as "Record-Breaker" in Pro Kabaddi League circles, is nursing a shoulder injury after a fall during a practice session. His participation in the upcoming Patna Pirates match remains questionable. He is undergoing treatment under the watchful eyes of the team physio at the Kalinga Stadium.
normalised: Kabaddi player, Pardeep Narwal, known as "Record-Breaker" in Pro Kabaddi League circles, is nursing a shoulder injury after a fall during a practice session. His participation in the upcoming Patna Pirates match remains questionable. He is undergoing treatment under the watchful eyes of the team physio at the Kalinga Stadium.

unnormalised: Badminton sensation, PV Sindhu, is still recovering from a knee injury sustained during the Commonwealth Games. Although she has resumed light training, her return to competitive badminton is expected only by early next year. She was recently seen drawing inspiration from the movie ‘Chak De! India’ during her rehabilitation, quoting its famous dialogue about fighting for honour.
normalised: Badminton sensation, P V Sindhu, is still recovering from a knee injury sustained during the Commonwealth Games. Although she has resumed light training, her return to competitive badminton is expected only by early next year. She was recently seen drawing inspiration from the movie ‘Chak De! India’ during her rehabilitation, quoting its famous dialogue about fighting for honour.

unnormalised: Elsewhere, in hockey, veteran defender Rupinder Pal Singh is struggling with a recurring back problem. The extent of the injury and his availability for the upcoming Asian Champions Trophy are yet to be confirmed. The team is hoping that regular sessions with Dr. Ali Irani, the renowned sports physiotherapist, will improve his condition.
normalised: Elsewhere, in hockey, veteran defender Rupinder Pal Singh is struggling with a recurring back problem. The extent of the injury and his availability for the upcoming Asian Champions Trophy are yet to be confirmed. The team is hoping that regular sessions with Doctor Ali Irani, the renowned sports physiotherapist, will improve his condition.

unnormalised: In athletics, promising long-distance runner Avinash Sable is reportedly experiencing fatigue after a grueling season. He is taking a short break to recuperate and is expected to resume training shortly, focusing on the Paris Olympics qualifiers. He's currently resting and focusing on diet, taking in around 5000 calories per day to recover.
normalised: In athletics, promising long-distance runner Avinash Sable is reportedly experiencing fatigue after a grueling season. He is taking a short break to recuperate and is expected to resume training shortly, focusing on the Paris Olympics qualifiers. He's currently resting and focusing on diet, taking in around five thousand calories per day to recover.

unnormalised: Updates on these injuries will be provided as more information becomes available. Team managements are prioritizing player welfare, ensuring a cautious approach to their return to competitive sport. Every R is being spent on the recovery process. It will cost 100s of Rs., and probably 1000s of Rs.
normalised: Updates on these injuries will be provided as more information becomes available. Team managements are prioritizing player welfare, ensuring a cautious approach to their return to competitive sport. Every rupee is being spent on the recovery process. It will cost hundreds of rupees, and probably thousands of rupees.
